title: Mirrors - Installation

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
Do not support the motorcycle on any ancillary component, the exhaust system or any other non structural parts of the motorcycle frame.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall resulting in motorcycle damage, serious injury or death.
Make sure the friction ring fully fitted to the handlebar and is flush with the end of the handlebar.
Make sure the mirror is completely on the the friction ring when tightening the pinch bolt.
Fit the mirror and its friction ring as noted for removal and tighten the pinch bolt to
When fitted, make sure there is a gap between the handlebar end weight and the mirror.
Fit the spacer to the handlebar end weight assembly.
Fit the handlebar end weight assembly and tighten the new fixing to
Position the mirrors to give rear visibility in the riding position. Do not rotate the mirror beyond 75°, measured from the vertical section of the mirror arm.
